intro: Ecbolium polygonoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It is often found growing in sandy or gravelly soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Ecbolium polygonoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
